info.title: Instatus API
info.description:
API for managing status pages, components, incidents, and more on Instatus.

- All endpoints are generally follow the REST architecture.
- All requests must be encoded as JSON with the "Content-Type: application/json header".
- Responses from the Instatus API, including errors, are encoded as JSON as well.
- Requests to Instatus API must provide an API token through the Authorization header.
- You can get your API key from User settings developer settings: https://dashboard.instatus.com/developer

get.description:
Retrieve a list of your status pages or Get your status page secure link
The default page number is 1.
The default per_page number is 50 and the maximum is 100 items per page.

If your account has member / owner access to a private status page with secure links enabled, 
you're allowed to get the secure link to your page. (you will get a secureLink property in the response)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of items per page

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.description: The ID of the status page to update

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.description: The ID of the status page to delete

get.description: Retrieve the profile information of the authenticated user

Retrieve the current status summary of the status page 
- The base url is your status page url
- An example is https://instat.us/summary.json

get.description: Retrieve logs for a specific monitor

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the monitor

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of items per page. Cannot exceed 1000.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve.

parameters.name: monitorId
parameters.description: The ID of the monitor.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location of the monitor.

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: The creation date. Can be a string, a number, or an object with gte and lte fields.

parameters.name: isSuccessful
parameters.description: Whether the check was successful.

parameters.name: isSSLCheck
parameters.description: Whether the check is an SSL check.

parameters.name: httpStatusCode
parameters.description: The HTTP status code of the response.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the monitor.

parameters.name: dnsTime
parameters.description: Time taken for DNS resolution.

parameters.name: tcpTime
parameters.description: Time taken for TCP connection.

parameters.name: tlsTime
parameters.description: Time taken for TLS handshake.

parameters.name: firstByteTime
parameters.description: Time taken for the first byte to be received.

parameters.name: downloadTime
parameters.description: Time taken for the download.

parameters.name: responseTime
parameters.description: Total response time.

parameters.name: performanceTime
parameters.description: Performance time.

parameters.name: accessabilityScore
parameters.description: Accessibility score.

parameters.name: seoScore
parameters.description: SEO score.

parameters.name: bestPracticesScore
parameters.description: Best practices score.

parameters.name: successfulAssertions
parameters.description: Number of successful assertions.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Field to sort by.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location of the monitor. Must be one of the specified values.

post.description: Keep in mind in actions `targetId` can be a workspace member email or a team id depending on the type of the action.

Translations.description: Object containing translations where each key is a property name and the value is an object with language codes as keys and translations as values. The language code as the key (e.g., 'en', 'fr') and the translation as the value.

name.en: This will be displayed for English users
name.fr: Ceci sera affich pour les utilisateurs francophones
